item.title: Why don't people with mental health problems just get a job?
item.description:
Why don't people with mental health problems just get a job?

Last week I went to the House of Lords, something I found quite intimidating. Thankfully I was supported by a member of Rethink campaigns team in giving oral evidence to a Parliamentary Review. Chaired by Lord Low of Dalston, the Review was set up to assess the likely impact of a proposed benefit cut.

item.title: Creating a future beyond the Work Capability Assessment (WCA) (now with easy read version)
item.description:
Creating a future beyond the Work Capability Assessment (WCA) (now with easy read version)

Following consultation with disability organisations, Ekklesia is conducting a survey of people with mental or physical health conditions in order to design a replacement for Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) and the Work Capability Assessment (WCA). We consider the WCA to be too flawed and broken to be satisfactorily fixed.
